reviews.review: Great fun! Frustrating when just starting out as you get the hang of the mechanics and level up. But the game has a good community, havent experinced any negativity. Most games end with GGs all around. Occasionaly ill get FPS drops, but that may just be on my end and not any issue of the game itself. Ques can be inconsistant, sometimes super fast, others it takes a few min.

傻逼制作组！前冲翻板没了已经过分了，现在打击，自摸，弹射都给你们改成什么样了？我可以骂你们制作组傻逼吗！讲道理你们已经改的我快玩不下去了！到了这个版本，前冲翻板也没了，包括正面翻板，全部改成了扭身翻板。真的是都快没法玩了，本来板子就少的可怜，人类难度已经相当大了，你还要继续削，脑子有屎吧！未来的屠夫真的是毫无技术可言了，是个傻子都能四杀！我有预感，你们要这么改动，会失去一大批老玩家！即使你们安利的再便宜，也不会有真爱了！

Will change review when Freddy gets the hammer. Also really shady business practice for a competitve game to release new dlc that gives the player op killers, that will eventually get the nerf hammer. I understand the need to fine tune  mechanics as new things are added. But QA really dropped the ball if they believed that this new killer is in anyway balanced.

Also, if a dev reads this I want to let you know that I was going to buy several copies of this game for friends for halloween so we could have some fun, and even though the game is marked half off, I have lost all interest in doing so because of the shit show it would be trying to find a match without a freddy killer, and my friends frustration of entering a match and losing it in the first 3 minutes. You lost out on additional sales, and I'm sure this is causing people to leave the community because of your current blunder.

Dead by Daylight. Tot by Buglight. Ne aber jetzt mal ehrlich. In den meisten Fällen funktioniert Hart im Nehmen einfach nicht. Oder die Hitbox deines Charakters ist einfach mal viel zu groß. Das Spiel macht echt Spaß - aber wenn man dann gefacecamped wird, weil man zu gut ist, und weil der Killer einfach sauer wird, kann man als Überlebender nichts dagegen machen. Man sollte am besten, da man das Spiel mit dem nächsten Update eh so drastisch verändert, etwas einführen, damit killer wenn sie zu lange im direkten Umfeld eines Überlebenden am Haken sind, dass sie eine 10 Sekunden Blendung bekommen. Na, aber das ist ja egal. Ansonsten macht das Spiel echt Spaß und ich werde es auch noch definitv weiter spielen.

So I bought this game my mates, we thought "Why not? Lets get a scary game". My friend being the control freak he is loaded us up into a private game where he immediately chose to be a Wraith. I spawned in, crept around the edge of the map not knowing what on earth I had to do. Soon after spawn in my mate starts giggling and I hear "ding ding", the wraith turns visible and there I am... standing there staring at this "thing". I turn around screaming at the top of my lungs, my arms start shaking and my eyes start watering. Funnily enough my mate lost me because, and quote, "My squeal was so funny that whilst in chase he was laughing so hard his tears trickled down his face and impaired his vision", therefore, I escaped. 

Basically the game is super scary at first and then just becomes annoying. Specially when playing people who are camping the hooks and downed bodies not allowing you to get up.
amazing game but freddy kruegar is op XD

LOL now they doing NFTs genuinely could not be more disgusted with a game, or game company. What the actual hell is wrong with bhvr lmao

So. This game is fun, and it gave me a lot of enjoyment for the 1000+ hours I played it for. I won't pretend like I always hated this game or that it's always been a shitshow, but ever since the fucking clown update BHVR has continuously put in micro-transaction schemes that are extremely hostile especially to neuro-divergent people like myself. This game is NOT free to play, and yet nearly every free to play micro-transaction scheme is present in the game, save for loot boxes, which is a very small blessing. This game will devour your wallet, the devs will not fix the plethora of bugs they add with every update and PAID DLC they release, opting instead of pinch every penny out of your wallet and adding new, exciting broken features to their already busted game. I've never been more disappointed in a game I loved. I thought the separation from starbreeze would make things way better, and for a while it did. But then it got worse. 

0/10

[Previous review below]
Honestly? The game is so much better than it was when I originally reviewed it, and still much better after I edited my initial review. I'm gonna keep the old review in, but in parenthesis. That review is outdated, but feel free to read it.

Since the dead by daylight team at bhvr seperated from starbreeze, I have been nothing but impressed. They have a very voherent plan laid out for their game, and it seems like they are actually focusing on making a game they love rather than making it for money. The changes are well welcomed, the balance changes were much needed and the pallet changes are excellent. Most of the negative reviews you will see on this game recently are people very upset about the balance changes. The balance changes have actually made things more balanced, and they don't like it because they aren't as good anymore. Which is understandable since if you bought the game for that reason and don't get that feeling anymore I would also be disappointed, but you also have to realise this is more how the game was envisioned.

The community for this game is, to be honest, terrible. Only in rust have I seen a community more toxic and abysmal than the Dead by Daylight community. However, the game is still extremely enjoyable and fun, and you can also just hide the chat so you don't have to deal with people. All in all, this game is easily one of my favorites, and I only see it getting better in the future.

However I still stand fully by my statement that the doctor is the actual worst part of any video game I have EVER played. But that's just an opinion.

TL;DR This game is fun, the community is shit, the devs are working on making the game a better experience and I couldn't be happier with the direction they're going.

8/10

Since the Freddy nerf, things have been a lot happier in DBD and i again, love this game! Though there are still SWF bugs, lobby errors and general in-game bugs, theyre not too game breaking.

The developers are very active within the community, they really do listen to what we say. They dont always have to agree with what we say, but they do listen. 

All in all, you should play it.

I'll try to keep it short and sweet.

I love this game, I genuinely do. It's a fun concept, extremely addicting, and a breath of fresh air from  most online multiplayer games.

The devs seem to be a small but dedicated team. Other players may say otherwise, but they listen to their players. It's easy to see that they're always keeping themselves busy and always looking on ways to grow and improve. You can feel that this game has heart and isn't just a pumped out cash grab. They want this game to be great and they want people to have fun.

It's a great game, it really is. But there's definitely room for improvement. 

Getting this out of the way. There are a few bugs here and there but like I said, the devs are always working on the game and usually try their best to fix it. I have to reset the game at least once every day for it to work right again ( it's usually trying to join servers with friends for me ).

_________________________________________

The amount of fun you'll have in a game relies completely on the 4 other people you're playing with. You can have extremely toxic survivors who DC as soon as things get tough. You can get extremely laggy killers who just suck all joy out of you as you lose your mind ( and your items ) losing in unplayable match running into walls and teleporting. You can get survivors who just hide, do nothing and wait for matches to play themselves out. You can get pallet looped by survivors and then get called a cheater as soon as you finally get them. Or you can get the infamous face camping killer with the combo of 3 crouching survivors watching you bleed out.

_________________________________________

With so many different ways to play the game, it's hard to really tell what's balanced and what's fun for most of the players. As soon as something changes, someone will be extremely vocal about how they hate it. You always have to look at game at every angle. You can't please everyone, but you can sure as hell try.

The game has so much potential with future killers, perks, maps, items, perks. They can do so much with it.

I personally would love if killers had some more incentive to get the hell away from the hook. I might of lost some people there lol. I would personally sacrifice a perk slot so that the entity would consume me slower if he's at a certain range. Or if Killers had a perk that would considerably speed it up if they leave. I know that other players can do gens while you're hanging there, odds are they wont, and that's not fun. I don't see how fun it could be staying in the same area can be either. 
_________________________________________

Less seriously. I wish the game would give itself a little more visual polish here and there. There are so many slots for character customization and it kills me seeing such little things you can do. There's so much potential with the killers especially to make some really fucking rad skins. It would be nice if levels started having some more personal aesthetics to them too to stir things up a bit. IE: like how Lery's memorial has unique hooks, it'd be nice to see gen's, doors, lockers get a change here and there. ( NOT the hatch though. )

Ever consider the steam workshop? 
_________________________________________

Overall, I highly recommend. You can play competitively, you can play for fun, you can play with friends or you can play alone, ect. I'm really pumped to see where this game goes next.
